connector.description: Execute commands on remote hosts using SSH.

camel.source.path.host.name: camel.source.path.host
camel.source.path.host.description: Sets the hostname of the remote SSH server.

camel.source.path.port.name: camel.source.path.port
camel.source.path.port.description: Sets the port number for the remote SSH server.

camel.source.endpoint.failOnUnknownHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.failOnUnknownHost
camel.source.endpoint.failOnUnknownHost.description: Specifies whether a connection to an unknown host should fail or not. This value is only checked when the property knownHosts is set.

camel.source.endpoint.knownHostsResource.name: camel.source.endpoint.knownHostsResource
camel.source.endpoint.knownHostsResource.description: Sets the resource path for a known_hosts file

camel.source.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeout
camel.source.endpoint.timeout.description: Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait in establishing the remote SSH server connection. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.pollCommand.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollCommand
camel.source.endpoint.pollCommand.description: Sets the command string to send to the remote SSH server during every poll cycle. Only works with camel-ssh component being used as a consumer, i.e. from(ssh://...) You may need to end your command with a newline, and that must be URL encoded %0A

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.channelType.name: camel.source.endpoint.channelType
camel.source.endpoint.channelType.description: Sets the channel type to pass to the Channel as part of command execution. Defaults to exec.

camel.source.endpoint.shellPrompt.name: camel.source.endpoint.shellPrompt
camel.source.endpoint.shellPrompt.description: Sets the shellPrompt to be dropped when response is read after command execution

camel.source.endpoint.sleepForShellPromp.name: camel.source.endpoint.sleepForShellPrompt
camel.source.endpoint.sleepForShellPromp.description: Sets the sleep period in milliseconds to wait reading response from shell prompt. Defaults to 100 milliseconds.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.certResource.name: camel.source.endpoint.certResource
camel.source.endpoint.certResource.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication. Will use ResourceHelperKeyPairProvider to resolve file based certificate, and depends on keyType setting.

camel.source.endpoint.certResourcePasswo.name: camel.source.endpoint.certResourcePassword
camel.source.endpoint.certResourcePasswo.description: Sets the password to use in loading certResource, if certResource is an encrypted key.

camel.source.endpoint.keyPairProvider.name: camel.source.endpoint.keyPairProvider
camel.source.endpoint.keyPairProvider.description: Sets the KeyPairProvider reference to use when connecting using Certificates to the remote SSH Server.

camel.source.endpoint.keyType.name: camel.source.endpoint.keyType
camel.source.endpoint.keyType.description: Sets the key type to pass to the KeyPairProvider as part of authentication. KeyPairProvider.loadKey(...) will be passed this value. From Camel 3.0.0 / 2.25.0, by default Camel will select the first available KeyPair that is loaded. Prior to this, a KeyType of 'ssh-rsa' was enforced by default.

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: Sets the password to use in connecting to remote SSH server. Requires keyPairProvider to be set to null.

camel.source.endpoint.username.name: camel.source.endpoint.username
camel.source.endpoint.username.description: Sets the username to use in logging into the remote SSH server.

camel.component.ssh.failOnUnknownHost.name: camel.component.ssh.failOnUnknownHost
camel.component.ssh.failOnUnknownHost.description: Specifies whether a connection to an unknown host should fail or not. This value is only checked when the property knownHosts is set.

camel.component.ssh.knownHostsResource.name: camel.component.ssh.knownHostsResource
camel.component.ssh.knownHostsResource.description: Sets the resource path for a known_hosts file

camel.component.ssh.timeout.name: camel.component.ssh.timeout
camel.component.ssh.timeout.description: Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait in establishing the remote SSH server connection. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds.

camel.component.ssh.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.ssh.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.ssh.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.ssh.pollCommand.name: camel.component.ssh.pollCommand
camel.component.ssh.pollCommand.description: Sets the command string to send to the remote SSH server during every poll cycle. Only works with camel-ssh component being used as a consumer, i.e. from(ssh://...) You may need to end your command with a newline, and that must be URL encoded %0A

camel.component.ssh.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.ssh.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ssh.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.ssh.channelType.name: camel.component.ssh.channelType
camel.component.ssh.channelType.description: Sets the channel type to pass to the Channel as part of command execution. Defaults to exec.

camel.component.ssh.shellPrompt.name: camel.component.ssh.shellPrompt
camel.component.ssh.shellPrompt.description: Sets the shellPrompt to be dropped when response is read after command execution

camel.component.ssh.sleepForShellPrompt.name: camel.component.ssh.sleepForShellPrompt
camel.component.ssh.sleepForShellPrompt.description: Sets the sleep period in milliseconds to wait reading response from shell prompt. Defaults to 100 milliseconds.

camel.component.ssh.certResource.name: camel.component.ssh.certResource
camel.component.ssh.certResource.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication. Will use ResourceHelperKeyPairProvider to resolve file based certificate, and depends on keyType setting.

camel.component.ssh.certResourcePassword.name: camel.component.ssh.certResourcePassword
camel.component.ssh.certResourcePassword.description: Sets the password to use in loading certResource, if certResource is an encrypted key.

camel.component.ssh.keyPairProvider.name: camel.component.ssh.keyPairProvider
camel.component.ssh.keyPairProvider.description: Sets the KeyPairProvider reference to use when connecting using Certificates to the remote SSH Server.

camel.component.ssh.keyType.name: camel.component.ssh.keyType
camel.component.ssh.keyType.description: Sets the key type to pass to the KeyPairProvider as part of authentication. KeyPairProvider.loadKey(...) will be passed this value. From Camel 3.0.0 / 2.25.0, by default Camel will select the first available KeyPair that is loaded. Prior to this, a KeyType of 'ssh-rsa' was enforced by default.

camel.component.ssh.password.name: camel.component.ssh.password
camel.component.ssh.password.description: Sets the password to use in connecting to remote SSH server. Requires keyPairProvider to be set to null.

camel.component.ssh.username.name: camel.component.ssh.username
camel.component.ssh.username.description: Sets the username to use in logging into the remote SSH server.
